Bar Chart: Upcoming 20 Days of Heber City Hotel Rates

What time of the year is best for visiting Heber City, Utah?

Heber City enjoys four distinct seasons each year and welcomes visitors all year round. Visit in the winter, and you can expect lows in the single digits, along with over 70 inches of snow throughout the season. Arrive in the spring or fall, and you'll find average highs in the low 60s. The summer usually brings highs in the upper 80s and very little rainfall.

Summer is festival season in the Heber Valley, so mark your calendar for annual events from early June through late August. In late June, Bonanza brings a world-class lineup of musicians and bands to Heber City, while the Heber Outdoor Festival brings fly fishing classes and enthusiasts to the area in mid-August.

Below is a chart of the current pricing seasonality of hotels and motels in Heber City, UT:

Below we've posted 3 graphs displaying average price patterns by star rating class in Heber City, UT. Analyze these line graphs to determine the best time to make a reservation in Heber City for your upcoming travels.

How can you find the best luxury hotels in Heber City, Utah?

4 Star Average Prices: $183.33

The Heber City area is the perfect place to splurge on an upscale getaway. Browse the area's best luxury hotels and resorts.

When you stay at the Goldener Hirsch Inn, you'll be a short drive away from Heber City, and in your own luxurious world. This boutique property has just 20 rooms, but you'll find that there's plenty of space to stretch out and relax or plan your next adventure. All rooms include custom furnishings, plush robes, cozy fireplaces, and private balconies, and the inn's health club and hot tub are the perfect places to unwind after a day of adventures. Don't miss your chance to dine at the hotel's restaurant, known for its high-end European cuisine.

Book your stay at The Sky Lodge, and you'll be in the heart of Park City, just a few miles north of Heber City. This boutique property has 33 upscale rooms along with a fitness center, an indoor pool, and a restaurant and lounge. Traveling with a group? Reserve up to four meeting rooms for events and gatherings, and take advantage of average group discounts of over 50 percent.

For the ultimate luxury trip to the Heber City area, you can't go wrong at The St. Regis Deer Valley. This Park City resort has just under 174 rooms and every amenity you can imagine. From the state-of-the-art fitness center and outdoor pool to ski-in/ski-out access and spa treatments, this resort has it all. Be sure to reserve a table at your choice of on-site restaurants for a meal you won't soon forget. Hosting a corporate or private event? Inquire about the resort's 27,000 square feet of event space for events large or small.

What are the most affordable hotels around Heber City, UT?

3 Star Average Prices: $141.16

Visiting the Heber City area doesn't have to be expensive. Check out the area's top-rated affordable hotels.

When you book a room at the Best Western Plus Heber Valley Hotel, you'll get a surprising amount of value out of your stay. In addition to large, well-appointed rooms, this budget-friendly hotel has a long list of extras, including an indoor pool, an on-site fitness room, and free Wi-Fi. Start your day with the hotel's free hot breakfast buffet or stock up on snacks and drinks at the on-site market. Hosting an event in the Heber City area? Reserve the 1,500-square-foot meeting space or the 120-person banquet space to make event planning a breeze.

Stay at the Holiday Inn Express Heber City, and you can look forward to contemporary rooms and all the basics you need for a comfortable stay. The hotel's indoor swimming pool is open for family fun all year round, and the complimentary breakfast buffet is the ideal way to fuel up for an active day in Heber City. Traveling for work? Business travelers will also appreciate the free Wi-Fi, business center, and complimentary coffee.

Located in nearby Park City, the Treasure Mountain Inn is a great pick for a stay that won't break the bank. This inn features 56 condo-style rooms equipped with kitchens, separate bedrooms, and plenty of space to work or relax. Traveling with a group? Take advantage of generous group discounts, which average 15 percent, and reserve up to three event spaces for meetings, corporate lunches, and presentations. Call ahead to take advantage of the complimentary airport shuttle for a stress-free arrival and departure.

2 Star Average Prices: $115.89

Which Heber City hotels offer the best discounts?

Why pay more than necessary for your Heber City accommodations? Get the best group rates and hotel discounts, no matter how long you're planning to stay in the area.

AARP members can get low rates at the Homestead Resort. This Midway, Utah, resort features 100 well-appointed guest rooms along with an 18-hole championship golf course, an outdoor pool, and opportunities for outdoor recreation like skiing, mountain biking, and much more. This year-round resort also features an AVEDA concept spa and over 15,000 square feet of event space for your next conference or wedding.

AAA members can get discounts at The Chateaux Deer Valley. This four-star resort has everything you want from a getaway in the Park City area. This resort checks all the boxes with an outdoor swimming pool and hot tub, a spa and salon, a restaurant and lounge, and numerous recreation opportunities. With 34,000 square feet of event space and an average group discount of nearly 23 percent, this resort is ideal for large events and groups visiting the Heber City area.

What are the best value options in Heber City, Utah?

Looking for that hotel sweet spot with the ideal balance of price and amenities? Take a look at the best value options in Heber City.

Book your stay at Deer Valley Resort, and you can enjoy an upscale property with an outdoor pool and free breakfast but without premium prices. Groups can get even more value from a stay here, as the resort offers an average group discount of 25 percent along with nearly 10,000 square feet of event space. Whether you're visiting during ski season or during the gorgeous summer season, you'll enjoy this charming lodge, the highly rated restaurant, and the complimentary Park City shuttle.

When you stay at Black Bear Lodge by ResortQuest, you'll enjoy stunning scenery and a beautiful property in the heart of the Park City resort area. You'll love the well-appointed rooms, the outdoor pool, and the easy access to both Park City and Heber City. During the summer, this resort also offers an indoor/outdoor venue in addition to its 11,000 square feet of event space.

Also located in the heart of Park City, The Caledonian offers nine condo-style rooms that sleep small groups. Whether you're traveling with family or friends, you'll appreciate the extra space, the full kitchens, and the cozy fireplaces in addition to the beautiful location.

What attractions should you check out while staying in Heber City, UT?

No matter what time of year you visit, there's always something happening in Heber City. Kids and adults alike will have a great time on the Heber Valley Historic Railroad, a steam locomotive that invites you to step back in time to the 19th century. Choose from routes like the Provo Canyon Limited, which transports passengers through the Heber Valley and Provo Canyon, or hop on the Monday Night Train, which features musical entertainment and family-friendly treats. The railroad also offers themed trips for the holidays, so check the event calendar before you go.

Want to catch a rodeo, demolition derby, or the Wasatch County Fair? Make the Wasatch Valley Event Complex your destination for local events ranging from barrel racing and ranch sorting to cowboy poetry and other unique performances.

You can't visit Heber City without exploring the great outdoors, so make Jordanelle State Park your next destination. Perched on the shore of the Jordanelle Reservoir, this popular state park is home to three different recreation areas. Whether you're in the mood for hiking and picnicking or you'd rather boat or fish, this is the ideal place. Planning a winter visit? The park's Strawberry Snowmobiling Complex is open for snowy fun, and the park also hosts ice fishing tournaments and other winter sports competitions.

Eager for more outdoor fun? Spend an afternoon or an entire weekend at Deer Creek State Park, just a short drive away from downtown Heber City. Deer Creek Reservoir is the perfect place to fish, swim, and windsurf, and you can also kayak and canoe in the cool water. For an unforgettable adventure, book a kiteboarding session or a zip line tour, where you can see the state park from an entirely new perspective.

Whether you're spending a week or a weekend in Heber City, you'll find countless adventures here. Find the ideal place to stay in the Wasatch Back, and start planning your trip to Heber City today.

FAQs about hotels in Heber City

What are the best rated hotels in Heber City?

Best Western Plus Heber Valley Hotel, Stein Eriksen Residences and Deer Valley Resort are the best rated hotels based on customer reviews in the last 365 days.

What are the most luxurious hotels in Heber City?

Stein Eriksen Lodge Deer Valley, Montage Deer Valley and The St. Regis Deer Valley are the top 3 luxury hotels near Heber City city center.

What hotels are closest to the city center of Heber City?

Best Western Plus Heber Valley Hotel, Holiday Inn Express Heber City, an IHG Hotel, and Black Rock Mountain Resort are the properties closest to Heber City city center.

How much does a cheap hotel in Heber City cost per night?

In the last year, a 2 star hotel in Heber City can be as cheap as $115.89 per night. (based on HotelPlanner prices)

How much does a 3 star hotel in Heber City cost per night?

In the last year, the average 3 star hotel in Heber City has been $141.16 per night. (based on HotelPlanner prices)

How much does a high-end hotel in Heber City cost?

In the last year, the average 4 star hotel in Heber City has been $183.33 per night. (based on HotelPlanner prices)
